cards.rules_text:
Escalate {1}{W} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
• Abound, abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)

Flash
When Adiran Distractor enters, return up to one target creature you control and up to one target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.
{T}: Add one mana of any type that a land an opponent controls could produce.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]Not all were willing to blindly trust the promise of a new world, and traveled through portals of the mind before committing to portals of the body.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile two permanent cards from your graveyard.
You may cast Adiran Survivors from your graveyard.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]For twenty years after Felice's defeat, the people of Adira were forced to learn how to survive on a dying plane.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[+2]: Draw a card. At the beginning of your next end step, discard a card.
[-X]: Aerida deals X damage to target player.
[-5]: Take an extra turn after this one. You get an emblem with “Loyalty abilities of Aerida planeswalkers you control cost an additional +1 to activate.”

{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card from each of your libraries.
{1}{U}{R}, {T}, Discard your hand: Return each Study card from your graveyard to your hand.

Archive 5 (As this enters, shuffle the top five cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
You may play the top card of the archived library.
You can't play cards from your hand.

Menace
Whenever Algrin's Legacy becomes the target of a spell an opponent controls, that spell's controller loses 5 life unless they discard a card.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]While ultimately simply another piece in Aerida's puzzle, the necromancer dragon Algrin was far from a mere footnote in Adira's histories.
[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever Almgrove Ambassador blocks or becomes blocked, you may untap target creature and remove it from combat.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“If we must convert our greatest accomplishment into a refugee camp, then I suppose we should make sure they at the very least don't wreck the place.”
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Destroy target nonbasic land.
Abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I killed you once, and I can do it a second! You're nothing compared to me!”
—Aerida, to Felice
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Escalate {2} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Search your library for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
• Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Add {B}{B}{G}{G}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color. Each other player adds one mana of any color at the beginning of their next first main phase.
Draw X cards, then abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)
cards.flavor_text:
[i]As their new world unfurled before them, the mages of Arcanum couldn't help but add a touch of extravagance to the proceedings.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Your life total becomes 0. Until an opponent's next turn, you can't lose the game, your opponents can't win the game, and you can't gain life.
Take an extra turn after this one.
Exile Buy Time.

Lifelink
Instant and sorcery spells you control have lifelink.
{2}{R}{W}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
Each opponent sacrifices a creature that dealt damage this turn. You gain 2 life, then abound. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)
cards.flavor_text:
[i]In life, sins flooded his veins. In death, there was nothing left but mulch.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Charming Marauder enters, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Recite {2}{W} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters or if it would leave the battlefield.)

When Cognitive Fumigator enters, target opponent reveals their hand. You may choose a nonland card from it and exile that card. If you do, that player draws a card.
Recite {2}{U} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters or if it would leave the battlefield.)
Whenever a land enters, Collapsing Realities deals 2 damage to each player.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]With every passing day, more of Adira fell prey to the natural entropy that Felice had held off for so long, now eager to resume its work.
[/i]

cards.rules_text: Abound. Then search your library for a creature, instant, or sorcery card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)
cards.flavor_text:
[i]After centuries of study and preparation, the mages of Arcanum could only look on in awe as they accomplished the impossible.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Escalate {G} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Target creature gets +3/+2 until end of turn.
• Target creature gains trample and hexproof until end of turn.

Escalate {B} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Put target permanent on top of its owner's library.
• For each library, look at the top three cards of that library, put any number of them into their owner's graveyard, then the rest back on top in any order.

Escalate {2} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more —
• Counter target spell.
• Destroy target creature.
• Discard your hand, then draw two cards.

Escalate {R}{R} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Culminating Chaos deals 2 damage to each creature and each planeswalker.
• Exile the top two cards of your library and add {R}{R}. Until end of turn, you may play those cards.

Escalate {U}{U} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Shuffle any number of cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards plus one.

Escalate {B}{B} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Destroy target creature.
• Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

Escalate {W}{W} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.
• You gain 6 life.

Escalate {G}{G} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or more. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
• Search your library for a land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

Each player discards their hand and sacrifices all permanents they control, draws seven cards, then abounds seven times. (To abound, you may cast a spell that costs less than this from your hand without paying its mana cost.)

Flash
Creatures other than Equilibrium Paladin that entered this turn lose all abilities and have base power and toughness 1/1.

Other creatures get -1/-1.
Recite {1}{B} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters or if it would leave the battlefield.)

Whenever Fallacy's Channeler becomes untapped, each player sacrifices a creature.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Fallacy's Channeler deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]Through blood and through influence, Ser Fallacy far outlived her death.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flash
When Fallacy's Sanctifier enters, exile up to three target cards from graveyards.
Recite {2} (You may cast this creature from your graveyard for its recite cost. If you do, exile it when it enters or if it would leave the battlefield.)
{1}, {T}: Exile the top two cards of your library, then put a card exiled with Fate Charm on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]At the spell's most tenuous point, when it seemed the spell would fail and the new world would be yet another failed experiment, a surge of fresh power stabilized the spell and carried it to completion. And from the crowd stepped a face Aerida had never expected to see again.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, for each of your libraries, look at the top card of that library, then put it on the top or bottom of that library.
{2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

[+2]: Each player can cast only one more spell until your next turn.
[-3]: Exile all other permanents, then return them to the battlefield tapped under their owner's control. Creatures can't attack you or planeswalkers you control until your next turn.
[-8]: Return all permanent cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

Exile X target permanents you control. Return them to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]With Aerida defeated and her deeds exposed, Felice turned to the rest of Arcanum's academic elite and made her demand: to let her use their new subplane as a refuge for her people.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Archive 5 (As this enters, shuffle the top five cards of your main library into a new face up library. Sacrifice this after the archived library is empty.)
Whenever a permanent card is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may put that card on the bottom of the archived library.

Defender
Foliage Hunter has deathtouch as long as you've cast a spell this turn.

[i]“Stop beating around the bush and just kill the damn thing!”
—Telam, last words

cards.rules_text:
Flying, prowess
Whenever one or more creatures attack, you gain life equal to the greatest power among those creatures.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you may have Heraldry become an Angel creature in addition to its other types or stop being a creature.

Escalate {G} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Target creature you control gains deathtouch and indestructible until end of turn.
• Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control.

Escalate {R} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Untap all creatures you control.
• Take an extra turn after this one. Skip the untap step of that turn. Exile Inspire Actuality.

Each player may play an additional land on each of their turns.
Whenever a land enters, each player may draw a card.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“This world is newborn and unformed. It must be carefully tended to, if it is to flourish.”
—Graide, Voice of Autumn
[/i]

cards.rules_text: As long as you control an Island, you may cast this spell as a copy of any creature on the battlefield. (This includes casting cost.)

Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell that targets only one target or activates an ability that targets only one target, copy that spell or ability for each other target it could target. Each copy targets a different one of those targets. (A spell or ability can't target itself.)

Whenever a player casts a spell, that player exiles the top card of each library face down.
Each player may look at and play cards they exiled with Mystic of Many Winds.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]She tangles the fates of three worlds, and hopes to lose her enemies in the resulting knot.
[/i]

cards.rules_text:

Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or planeswalker.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Was it any surprise that I followed you? The only person to ever challenge me?”
—Aerida, to Felice
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
This spell costs {1}{B} less to cast if it targets a green or white permanent.
Destroy target creature or planeswalker.
cards.flavor_text:

—Felice, to Aerida
[/i]

cards.rules_text:
This spell costs {1}{U} less to cast if it targets a red or green spell.
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I was a prodigy, the shining star. Yet you surpassed me, again and again!”
—Aerida, to Felice
[/i]

[/i]

cards.flavor_text:

—Aerida, to Felice
[/i]
